alert.note: Alert for Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 12 at 8:41PM PDT until October 13 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures expected. * WHERE...Wallowa County. * WHEN...Until 8 AM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Widespread sub-freezing temperatures of 28-32 degrees are forecast for the Wallowa Valley overnight into Friday morning.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
